intro: Filago inexpectata, commonly known as the unexpected filago, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Filago inexpectata typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
